title: nf-core/vina pipeline parameters
description: High-throughput, containerized molecular docking using AutoDock Vina with modern ligand and receptor preparation

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the docking jobs.
input.help_text: You will need to create a samplesheet with information about receptor-ligand pairs before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with at minimum 3 columns (sample, receptor, ligand), and a header row. Optional columns include center_x, center_y, center_z, size_x, size_y, size_z for per-sample docking box definitions. See [usage docs](https://nf-co.re/vina/usage#samplesheet-input).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

docking_box_options.title: Docking box options
docking_box_options.description: Define the search space for molecular docking. These are global defaults that can be overridden per-sample in the samplesheet.

center_x.description: X coordinate of the docking box center (Angstroms).
center_x.help_text: The X coordinate of the center of the search space. This can also be specified per-sample in the samplesheet.

center_y.description: Y coordinate of the docking box center (Angstroms).
center_y.help_text: The Y coordinate of the center of the search space. This can also be specified per-sample in the samplesheet.

center_z.description: Z coordinate of the docking box center (Angstroms).
center_z.help_text: The Z coordinate of the center of the search space. This can also be specified per-sample in the samplesheet.

size_x.description: Size of the docking box in X dimension (Angstroms).
size_x.help_text: The size of the search space in the X dimension. Default is 20 Angstroms.

size_y.description: Size of the docking box in Y dimension (Angstroms).
size_y.help_text: The size of the search space in the Y dimension. Default is 20 Angstroms.

size_z.description: Size of the docking box in Z dimension (Angstroms).
size_z.help_text: The size of the search space in the Z dimension. Default is 20 Angstroms.

docking_parameters.title: Docking parameters
docking_parameters.description: Parameters controlling the AutoDock Vina docking algorithm.

exhaustiveness.help_text: Higher values increase the probability of finding the global minimum but also increase computation time. Recommended values: 8 for quick screens, 32 for production runs, 64+ for high-accuracy studies.

num_modes.description: Maximum number of binding modes to generate.
num_modes.help_text: The maximum number of docking poses to output, ranked by binding affinity.

energy_range.description: Maximum energy difference from the best mode (kcal/mol).
energy_range.help_text: Poses with binding energy more than this value above the best pose will not be reported.

molecule_preparation.title: Molecule preparation options
molecule_preparation.description: Parameters for receptor and ligand preparation.

receptor_ph.help_text: The pH value used to determine the protonation state of ionizable residues in the receptor. Default is physiological pH (7.4).

ligand_ph.help_text: The pH value used to determine the protonation state of ionizable groups in the ligand. Default is physiological pH (7.4).

remove_water.description: Remove water molecules from receptor PDB.
remove_water.help_text: Remove water molecules (HOH, WAT, H2O, TIP, SPC, SOL residues) from the receptor structure before preparation. This is recommended for docking.

remove_heteroatoms.description: Remove all heteroatoms from receptor PDB.
remove_heteroatoms.help_text: Remove all HETATM records including waters, ligands, ions, and cofactors from the receptor. Use this when you want a clean protein-only structure.

virtual_screening.title: Virtual screening options
virtual_screening.description: Options for high-throughput virtual screening with multiple receptors and/or ligands.

screening_mode.help_text: When enabled, the pipeline generates all combinations of receptors Ã— ligands from the samplesheet. Use this for screening many ligands against one or more targets.

ligand_library.description: Path to multi-molecule SDF file for virtual screening.
ligand_library.help_text: A single SDF file containing multiple ligand molecules for virtual screening. Each molecule will be extracted and docked against all receptors.

receptor_list.description: Path to file listing receptor PDB files.
receptor_list.help_text: A text file with one receptor PDB path per line. All ligands will be docked against all receptors in this list.

binding_site_detection.title: Binding site detection options
binding_site_detection.description: Options for automatic binding site detection from co-crystallized ligands.

auto_binding_site.description: Auto-detect binding site from co-crystallized ligand.
auto_binding_site.help_text: When enabled, the pipeline automatically detects the docking box center and size from co-crystallized ligands in the receptor PDB file. This is useful when the receptor comes from an X-ray co-crystal structure.

ligand_id.description: Specific ligand residue name to use for binding site detection.
ligand_id.help_text: If the PDB contains multiple ligands, specify the 3-letter residue name (e.g., 'MK1', 'ATP') to use for binding site detection. If not specified, the largest ligand will be used.

box_padding.description: Padding around the ligand for box size (Angstroms).
box_padding.help_text: The padding in Angstroms to add around the co-crystallized ligand when calculating the docking box size. Default is 5 Angstroms on each side.

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

pipelines_testdata_base_path.description: Base URL or local path to location of pipeline test dataset files

trace_report_suffix.description: Suffix to add to the trace report filename. Default is the date and time in the format yyyy-MM-dd_HH-mm-ss.

help_full.description: Display the full detailed help message.

show_hidden.description: Display hidden parameters in the help message (only works when --help or --help_full are provided).
